intro: Wikstroemia pachyrachis, commonly known as the broad-leafed sandarac, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a source of sandarac. Its leaves are typically broad and革质 (leathery), providing a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested or disturbed habitats.
